content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well put together.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Such a fondamental exercice, no one dared adding it to CodinGame.
But it is indeed worth it.

Because you give all the formulae in the statement, this exercice is more about formatting and not duplicating points, and less about polynomials. (Which is totally fine)

I like this one. I compiled a list of corrections I would make, mostly small language things.

Goal section:
* next to delta = 0, in "there is unique root", the word root needs an article. The new text becomes "there is a unique root".
* In "that is, by the same time, the minima or maxima of the function", maxima and minima are in plural form, and need to be changed to maximum and minimum. I would also change "by the same time" to "also", and remove the commas. The new text between parentheses becomes: "that is also the minimum or maximum of the function".
* The line below that, you have a formatting error with delta > 0. Changing it to 0 < delta would probably fix it, but ideally you'd want a fix which keeps the delta on the left side of the equation, for symmetry with the cases above. I don't know a fix that does that.

Output section
* "a coma-separated" -> "a comma-separated"
* Change "with each point respecting format" to either "with each point respecting the format" or "with each point formatted as" (I like the last one better).
* P should be formatted.
* (x,y) should be formatted as a formula.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy puzzle with some high school math but not too complicated. It reminded me of happy days

In the special case y = 0, the only point to output will be (0,0).
i think it s
In the special case a,b,c = 0, the only point to output will be (0,0).
No?

This is my first contribution.
Does it look sufficiant to you ?
The test cases are very simple, but they are covering every possible case.
Please format the variables in the Constraints section. Thanks.

Yes, I thought that was implicit.
I just added this precision.
Thank you for all these corrections !

You're right.
But CodinGame's goal is to learn code.
This one has an easy level.
If I commit a puzzle about Fourier transform without giving the formulas, maybe it could be a medium or difficult one (because of Maths, not code) ;-)
